Dear Combined Systems Inc.,

Request to condemn and cease supplying equipment to Hong Kong Police Force

This letter serves to request Combined Systems Inc. to cease providing CSI equipmemt to the Hong Kong Police Force and condemn the Hong Kong government as a result of the serious misuse of your crowd control equipment in numerous protests took place in Hong Kong in the past two months. The Police had been documented to aim the tear gas at the protestors and jouralists, use expired rounds of tear gas, fire the tear gas from a height and even ignite the tear gas in crowded residential areas and metro station. As a US group devoted to peace and justice, Combined Systems Inc. should take prompt actions to halt the misuse of your equipment or casualty can be expected in the near future.

Below is the summary of some of the misuses of the tear gas by the Hong Kong Police Force:

On 12-6-2019, the police fired 150 rounds of tear gas for the crowd control during a protest. Though tear gas should be aimed at the ground at correct angle to avoid hitting people, the Police had been witnessed and photographed aiming at the protesters (Photo 1), resulting in a large number of injuries, including a driver of RTHK, the public broadcasting services of Hong Kong.

On 2-8-2019 and 5-8-2019, in order to disperse the protesters in Wong Tai Sin- one of the most densely populated areas in Hong Kong, the police fired a mass number of tear gas in the residential area, causing some residents feeling irritations of their eyes and respiratory systems. Some of the tear gas were even purposelessly ignited - when the police retreated and entered the police station, a few rounds of tear gas were fired towards the crowd, probably as a mean of retaliation (Photo 2,3,4,5 and 6).
(Link: The night quiet Hong Kong working-class neighbourhood Wong Tai Sin became a smoking battlegroundhttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/politics/article/3021387/night-quiet-working-class-neighbourhood-hong-kong-became)



On 5-8-2019, the police was witnessed firing tear gas from the rooftop of a skyscraper to the protesters on the ground. Doing so will doubtlessly injure the protesters and other people on the streets, but the police overlooked such concern put their lives at risk.
(Link: https://m.facebook.com/watch/?v=476973936466076&_rdr)
